name: tlog
body:
Tlog is a terminal I/O logging and playback package. It inserts itself (the
`tlog-rec` tool) between the user terminal and the user shell, and logs
everything that passes through as JSON messages.

The JSON messages are structured to be particularly suitable for storage and
searching by ElasticSearch, plus for (limited) human review. At the same time,
they preserve all the passed data and timing (with 1ms resolution).

At the moment terminal output playback is possible using the `tlog-play` tool
directly from ElasticSearch URL with the supplied query.

Tlog is intended to be used as part of a larger user session recording
solution, but is designed to be independent and reusable.

See also [a blog post on Open-Source Session Recording][blog_post] and the
[WIP design page][design_page].

[blog_post]: http://spbnick.github.io/2015/10/26/open-source-session-recording.html
[design_page]: http://www.freeipa.org/page/Session_Recording
